As a descendant of teachers, can confirm
Both parents, 3 of my granparents, at least one of my great grandparents...
My mother's one. She has some stories...
Honestly half the complaints are about the other teachers though.
They all sounds just, super unmotivated. Which seems bad for young kids.
Mother had that issue when she taught Junior High, when she started high school it cleared a lot of that up, now it's just lazy/incompetent admin.
Pops always taught hih school, always had issues with incompetent admin. Got fired from one school after he called the principal an idiot to his face.
Dont teachers have tenure or whatever
They technically have a union, got kicked out after he tried to get a strike going after the city froze their pay.
City loves him now, he was nominated Arizona's teacher of the year a few years ago and he was awared "teacher who makes a difference" just a few weeks back.
They gave him a little glass plaque and a $50 Amazon gift card.
:( I almost didn't get to see him recieve it, mom only found out the day of because he didn't tell anyone.
He hates making a deal out of stuff like this.
On the plus side, he was super happy when I showed up at city hall out of the blue for it.

So, I'm trying to figure out where to put the capital of Earth for my scifi setting.  These are my choices:

London, England  Geneva, Switzerland  Paris, France  Washington, D.C., USA  Sydney, Australia  Moscow, Russia  St. Petersburg, Russia  Abu Dhabi, UAE  Jerusalem, Israel  San Francisco, USA New York City, USA
Well, after talking with some other people, Jerusalem, Washington, DC, St. Petersburg, and Moscow are out due to political issues.
I always just find it hard to believe there can be one capital on a planet like ours
so filled with hatred and such
Well, this is the future so, you can fudge things a bit.
But @Bgrmystr2 where you put the capital of Earth then?
@SpazztasticKiwi  that's a good suggestion, but why would you put it there?
It’s big, well talked about and seen as a to-go place, especially if you want to work in a creative career
I guess since it wasn't obscenely obvious, I wouldn't be able to put a "capital of earth" because there's too much strife.
Like acting, animation, big-time comic creation, etc - show business and artistic niches alike are associated with L.A., as well as “success” in general
Hm....Makes sense.  @Bgrmystr2 I knew what you were talking about, but if we started getting along, where would you put the capital of Earth in a scifi setting?
During good.  Just asking about where would put a capital of Earth in a scifi setting.
Pretty much.  Doing some world building.
Here for just half a sec, but why woud you exclude a city for political issues? Those political issues would be a point to leverage in a plot, not ignore.

If I were to be logical about a city for the capital of Earth, it would make sense to make it in a place that's a center of commerce. It needs to be a powerful city. In America, New York, Los Angeles, San Francisco; In Europe, London, Paris,  Rome;
You want there to be powerful commercial and political elements present in the capital, it should be the center, or at least the focus, of most things important.
Berlin would be way more optimal than London, Paris or Rome.
Just make it a megacity that covers the entire globe.
I think that there's a lot more history in the foundations of Rome or Paris, but that could be just because I'm not as well versed in the history of major German cities
History shmistory, Berlin is a place of power.
Rome and Paris are just tourist traps
